pageContent.Heading: Become an Incident Handling Expert
pageContent.Description: The E|CIH program provides a method-driven, holistic approach to organizational incident handling and response (IH&R). It equips professionals to effectively handle post-breach consequences while reducing financial and reputational impact.

Features.FeatureName: Master the complete incident response lifecycle from preparation to recovery.
Learn to handle diverse incidents including malware, cloud, and insider threats.
Develop skills in forensic readiness and evidence handling.

Features.Title: IH&R Process
Features.Description: Master the 9 stages of incident handling following NIST guidelines.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><circle cx="12" cy="12" r="10"/><polyline points="12 6 12 12 16 14"/></svg>

Features.Title: Forensic Readiness
Features.Description: Prepare for digital investigations with structured first response and evidence collection.

Features.Title: Malware Incident Response
Features.Description: Detect, contain, analyze, and recover from malicious software infections.

Features.Title: Email Security Handling
Features.Description: Validate and respond to email-based threats like phishing and data leaks.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path d="M4 4h16c1.1 0 2 .9 2 2v12c0 1.1-.9 2-2 2H4c-1.1 0-2-.9-2-2V6c0-1.1.9-2 2-2z"/><polyline points="22,6 12,13 2,6"/></svg>

Features.Title: Cloud Security Incidents
Features.Description: Manage security breaches within multi-cloud environments.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path d="M17.5 19a3.5 3.5 0 0 0 0-7h-1.5a7 7 0 1 0-11.91 4.44V15"/></svg>

Features.Title: Insider Threat Mitigation
Features.Description: Identify and respond to threats originating from within the organization.

pageContent.Title: Certified Threat Intelligence Analyst (CTIA)
pageContent.Subtitle: Master Threat Intelligence to Pre-empt and Mitigate Cyber Attacks

pageContent.Heading: Become a Threat Intelligence Expert
pageContent.Description: The C|TIA program is a specialist-level certification designed for individuals involved in collecting, analyzing, and disseminating threat intelligence. It provides a method-driven approach to turning raw data into actionable intelligence.

Features.FeatureName: Master the entire threat intelligence lifecycle from planning to dissemination.
Lab-intensive program covering 100% of NICE 2.0 and CREST frameworks.
Learn to identify and mitigate risks using advanced threat analysis tools.

Features.Title: Threat Intelligence Lifecycle
Features.Description: Master the complete process from requirements and planning to dissemination and review.

pageContent.Heading: Become a Network Security Expert
pageContent.Description: While Cisco consolidated the CCNA, the Security path focuses on defending Cisco networks. It cover the core technologies needed to protect network devices and the data that flows thorugh them.

Features.FeatureName: Master the implementation of secure network infrastrucutres.
Learn to configure Firewalls,VPNs, and Intrusion Prevention Systems(IPS).
Gain expertise in identity management and secure device access.

Features.Title: Secure Routing and Switching
Features.Description: Implement Layer 2 security,port security,and control protection

Features.FeatureName: Gain a foundational understanding of computer and network security.
Master practical steps to mitigate security exposure and identity theft.
Learn to secure mobile, cloud, and social media environments.

pageContent.Heading: Become a Digital Forensics Expert
pageContent.Description: C|HFI presents a methodological approach to digital forensics, including evidence analysis and intruder tracing. It provides the necessary skills for legal prosecution and network integrity protection.

Gain hands-on experience in 68+ labs using standard forensic tools.
Learn to investigate web attacks, malware, cloud, and mobile environments.

pageContent.Subtitle: our first step to joining a Security Operations Center (SOC).

pageContent.Heading: Become a SOC Operations Expert
pageContent.Description: The C|SA program is the first step to joining a Security Operations Center (SOC), engineered for current and aspiring Tier I and Tier II analysts. It provides the technical skills required to dynamically contribute to a high-functioning SOC team.

Features.FeatureName: Build job-ready skills with 50+ labs and 120+ tools simulating real-time environments.
Master end-to-end SOC workflows, including log management, SIEM deployment, and incident response.
Learn to identify and validate intrusion attempts using advanced threat monitoring and alert triaging.

pageContent.Title: One-of-a-kind learning framework, powered by AI

Steps.Description: 100% virtualization with full access to pre-configured targets, networks, and 4,000+ hacking tools. 550 attack techniques covered.
Take the knowledge exam (125 MCQs) and complete the practical exam (20 challenges) to earn CEH Master certification.
Apply your skills in real-world environments. Join an exclusive community of certified ethical hackers worldwide.
Year-long access to 12 CTF challenges. Monthly themes with capture-the-flag competitions. Climb the leaderboard.

ExamCards.Description: Test your knowledge of information security threats, attack vectors, detection, prevention, procedures, and methodologies.
Complete real-world challenges testing your practical skills in a live corporate network environment.

pageContent.Title: Certified Cloud Security Engineer (CCSE)
pageContent.Subtitle: Master multi cloud security across AWS,Azure & GCP with hands on expertise

pageContent.Heading: Become a Cloud Security Expert
pageContent.Description: A Certified Cloud Security Engineer (C|CSE) is a multi cloid security certification program crafted by industry experts. Gain a holistic understanding of cloud security blending vendor-neutral and vendor-specific concepts for AWS,Azure and GCP.

Features.FeatureName: Master multi-cloud security across AWS,Azure and GCP
Lab-intensive program with 50%+ hands on training
Industry-aligned curriculum coveting 10 comprehensive modules.

Features.Title: Multi-Cloud Proficiency
Features.Description: Practical security management across AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform.
Features.svgIcon:
<svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2">
                            <path d="M12 2L2 7l10 5 10-5-10-5zM2 17l10 5 10-5M2 12l10 5 10-5"></path>
                        </svg>

Features.Title: Identity & Access Management
Features.Description: Implement and manage secure access to cloud resources with IAM best practices.

<svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2">

Features.Description: Evaluate cloud network architecture and implement robust security controls.

Features.Title: Governance & Compliance

pageContent.Title: Train with eHack Academy
pageContent.Subtitle: EC-Council Authorized Training Center delivering C|CSE Certification
pageContent.AcademyHours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9:30 AM - 6:30 PM (Monday Off)

Steps.Description: 10 comprehensive modules covering cloud security fundamentals, platform security, data protection, and compliance across AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Lab-intensive program with 50%+ hands-on training in simulated cloud environments. Work on real-world cloud security scenarios.
Take the certification exam (125 MCQs, 4 hours) and earn your C|CSE credential with a 70% passing score requirement.
Join 77,000+ cloud security professionals. Access high-demand roles with salaries averaging $128,495 annually.

ExamCards.Description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of cloud security concepts, platforms, and best practices across AWS, Azure, and GCP environments.
EC-Council's C|CSE certification validates your expertise in designing, implementing, and managing cloud security for enterprise environments.

pageContent.Heading: Become a Penetration Testing Expert
pageContent.Description: CPENT is a comprehensive program that moves beyond flat networks to teach pen-testing for enterprise environments. It challenges students to attack, exploit, and evade defenses across advanced live ranges.

Features.FeatureName: Master pen-testing for IoT, OT, and segmented network environments.
Learn to write custom exploits, double pivot, and bypass advanced defenses.
Integrated AI techniques for efficiency in every pen-testing phase.

Features.Title: Pen-Testing Methodologies
Features.Description: Master scoping engagements, estimating effort, and following structured frameworks.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><circle cx="12" cy="12" r="10"/><circle cx="12" cy="12" r="6"/><circle cx="12" cy="12" r="2"/></svg>

Features.Title: Advanced Windows Attacks
Features.Description: Perform Active Directory exploitation and advanced Windows privilege escalation.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><rect x="3" y="3" width="18" height="18" rx="2" ry="2"/><path d="M9 3v18"/><path d="M3 11h18"/></svg>

Features.Title: Binary Exploitation & Reverse Engineering
Features.Description: Conduct binary analysis, write exploit code, and perform application fuzzing.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><polyline points="16 18 22 12 16 6"/><polyline points="8 6 2 12 8 18"/></svg>

Features.Title: Perimeter Defense Evasion
Features.Description: Evaluate and bypass firewall and IDS security implementations.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path d="M12 2L2 7l10 5 10-5-10-5z"/><path d="m2 17 10 5 10-5"/><path d="m2 12 10 5 10-5"/></svg>

Features.Title: IoT & OT Penetration Testing
Features.Description: Assess the security of smart devices and industrial operational technology.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path d="M12 2v4"/><path d="M12 18v4"/><path d="M4.93 4.93l2.83 2.83"/><path d="M16.24 16.24l2.83 2.83"/><path d="M2 12h4"/><path d="M18 12h4"/><path d="M4.93 19.07l2.83-2.83"/><path d="M16.24 7.76l2.83-2.83"/></svg>

Features.Title: Professional Report Writing
Features.Description: Compile actionable, professional reports providing business value post-testing.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path d="M14 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V8z"/><path d="M14 2v6h6"/><path d="M16 13H8"/><path d="M16 17H8"/><path d="M10 9H8"/></svg>

pageContent.Heading: Become an Enterprise Networking Expert
pageContent.Description: Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Enterprise validates your ability to scale and maintain complex enterprise networks. This professional-level certification focuses on deep technical knowledge and architectural mastery.

Features.FeatureName: Design and implement advanced routing and switching across campus networks.
Master SD-WAN,automation,and wireless infrastrucutre security.
Learn to optimize performance for high-availability enterprises services.

Features.Title: Dual-Stack Architecture
Features.Description: Deep dive into IPv4 and IPv6 coexistence and advanced addressing.

pageContent.Heading: Become a Networking Expert
pageContent.Description: The CCNA program is the foundation of modern networking, designed to validate your skills in installing, configuring, and operating a broad range of network technologies. It provides a comprehensive start for anyone looking to build a career in IT infrastructure.

Features.FeatureName: Master the fundamentals of IP connectivity, security, and automation.
Gain hands-on experience with real-world Cisco routing and switching hardware.
Learn to secure network access and manage modern wireless infrastructures.

Features.Title: Network Fundamentals
Features.Description: Understand routers, switches, cabling types, and the OSI/TCP-IP models.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path d="M5 12h14M5 12a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v4a2 2 0 01-2 2M5 12a2 2 0 00-2 2v4a2 2 0 002 2h14a2 2 0 002-2v4a2 2 0 00-2-2"/></svg>

Features.Title: IP Connectivity
Features.Description: Configure, verify, and troubleshoot IPv4 and IPv6 static and dynamic routing.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><polyline points="16 16 12 12 8 16"/><line x1="12" y1="12" x2="12" y2="21"/><path d="M20.39 18.39A5 5 0 0018 9h-1.26A8 8 0 103 16.3"/><polyline points="16 16 12 12 8 16"/></svg>

Features.Title: Security Fundamentals
Features.Description: Learn about threat defense, access control, and password policies.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><rect x="3" y="11" width="18" height="11" rx="2" ry="2"/><path d="M7 11V7a5 5 0 0 1 10 0v4"/></svg>

Features.Title: IP Services
Features.Description: Configure and verify DHCP, NAT, NTP, and SSH for enterprise networks.

Features.Title: Automation & Programmability
Features.Description: Introduction to controller-based networking, APIs, and software-defined architectures.
Features.svgIcon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><polyline points="16 18 22 12 16 6"/><polyline points="8 6 2 12 8 18"/></svg>

pageContent.Heading: Become an Information Systems Auditing Expert
pageContent.Description: The CISA program is the global standdard for professional who audit, control, monitor, and assess an oarganization's information technology and business systems. It validates your ability to manage vulnerabilities and ensure compliance within enterprise infrastructures.

Features.FeatureName: Master the process if auditing information systems according to global standards.
Gain expertise in IT governance, management and system aquisition.
Learrn to protect information assets and ensure business continuity through rigorous assessment.

Title: ISC2 Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

pageContent.Heading: Become a Cybersecurity Leadership Expert
pageContent.Description: CISSP is often called the "Gold Standard" of cybersecurity. It covers a vast breadth of 8 domains, ensuring a professional can design, implement and manage a best-in-class cybersecurity program.

Features.FeatureName: Master the deep architectural and management skills for enterprise security.
Gain expertise in security engineering, network security,and asset protection.
Learn to lead large-scale security operations and mange complex software security risks.

Features.Title: Security & Risk Management
Features.Description: Master ethics,risk management,compliance, and business continuity planning.

pageContent.Heading: Become a Networking Operations Expert
pageContent.Description: CompTIA Network+ validates the technical skills needed to securely estabilish,maintain, and troubleshoot the essential networks that businesses rely on.

Features.FeatureName: Master network configurations, management, and troubleshooting.
Learn about wierd and wireless network security and standards
Gain understanding of modern cloud and virtualization technologies.
